Class CardGameFramework

java.lang.Object
CardGameFramework
class CardGameFramework
extends java.lang.Object
A framework that handles cards for multiple players and a deck in a card game
Author:
unknown

  • Constructor Details

    • CardGameFramework

      public CardGameFramework​(int numPacks, int numJokersPerPack, int numUnusedCardsPerPack, Card[] unusedCardsPerPack, int numPlayers, int numCardsPerHand)
      Constructor for CardGameFramework
      Parameters:
      numPacks - number of packs per deck
      numJokersPerPack - number of jokers is each pack
      numUnusedCardsPerPack - number of unused card in each pack (certain games use fewer than the standard 52 cards)
      unusedCardsPerPack - array of any unused cards
      numPlayers - number of players
      numCardsPerHand - number of cards in each hand

    • CardGameFramework

      public CardGameFramework()
      constructor overload/default for game like bridge

      Returns:

      Accessor for how many cards are left in the deck
      Returns:
      int number of cards

    • newGame

      public void newGame()
      Initial setup for the game. Prepares the deck and shuffles it.

    • deal

      public boolean deal()
      Deals the apropriate number of cards into the players' hands
      Returns:
      true if deal was successful

    • sortHands

      void sortHands()
      Arranges the cards in the hands in order of value.

    • playCard

      Card playCard​(int playerIndex, int cardIndex)
      Plays a card from a players hand
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - int index to indicate which player is playing the card
      cardIndex - int index to indicate which card was played
      Returns:
      Card that was played

    • takeCard

      boolean takeCard​(int playerIndex)
      Takes a card from the deck and places it in the player's hand.
      Parameters:
      playerIndex - int index to indicate which player is taking the card
      Returns:
      true is successful
